video.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
video.synopsis: TV comedy writer Rob Petrie has his hands full balancing a suburban home life with pretty wife Laura and his work days with wise-cracking office pals.

episodes.synopsis: When 5-year-old Ritchie gets sick the night of a big party at Rob's boss's penthouse, Rob persuades Laura to hire a babysitter.
episodes.title: The Sick Boy and the Sitter

episodes.synopsis: Rob is jealous when Buddy claims boss Alan Brady gave him a new pipe. After the two of them argue over a script, Rob falls ill and goes home.
episodes.title: The Meershatz Pipe

episodes.synopsis: There's trouble in the Petrie home when Rob starts working nights. Laura's jealous that her husband is extremely busy with a gorgeous guest star.
episodes.title: Jealousy

episodes.synopsis: Laura thinks she's found the perfect match for unhappily single Sally -- her pharmacist cousin, Thomas Edson.
episodes.title: Sally and the Lab Technician

episodes.synopsis: Rob faces a dilemma when a business trip to Washington, D.C., falls on the same day as Ritchie's school play.
episodes.title: Washington vs. the Bunny

episodes.synopsis: When they find Rob's old Army boots in a closet, the Petries reminisces about his thwarted attempts to date Laura when she was a USO showgirl.
episodes.title: Oh How We Met the Night that We Danced

episodes.synopsis: An interesting anomaly, this pilot features series creator Carl Reiner in the role of Rob, and its failure forced Reiner to recast the show.
episodes.title: Head of the Family

episodes.synopsis: When Rob persuades Buddy to take his wife on a long-overdue honeymoon, Buddy suckers Rob into taking care of his German shepherd for a few days.
episodes.title: The Unwelcome Houseguest

episodes.synopsis: Rob suspsects that an old Army buddy he doesn't recognize may be a jewel thief posing as a long-lost friend.
episodes.title: Harrison B. Harding of Camp Crowder, MO

episodes.synopsis: Convinced she's losing her sex appeal after overworked Rob doesn't pay much attention to her -- and she finds a gray hair -- Laura goes blond.
episodes.title: My Blonde-Haired Brunette

episodes.synopsis: After teasing Laura and Ritchie for being forgetful, Rob realizes he forgot to order 44 tickets to "The Alan Brady Show" for the local PTA.
episodes.title: Forty-Four Tickets

episodes.synopsis: Chaos reigns in the Petrie household after Laura accepts Mel's offer to dance on "The Alan Brady Show."
episodes.title: To Tell or Not to Tell

episodes.synopsis: When Laura realizes Sally is treated like one of the guys at the office, she coaches Rob on how to treat his co-worker like a lady.
episodes.title: Sally Is a Girl

episodes.synopsis: A necklace Rob buys from Mel's cousin Maxwell is truly ugly -- but Laura can't bring herself to tell Rob how much she hates it.
episodes.title: Empress Carlotta's Necklace

episodes.synopsis: When Buddy is offered a job on another show, Rob and Mel help him get out of his contract by writing a memo complaining about his work and attitude.
episodes.title: Buddy, Can You Spare a Job?

episodes.synopsis: When Laura asks Rob to collect $25 Buddy owes him, Rob comes up with various schemes in an effort to help his co-worker remember the loan.
episodes.title: Who Owes Who What?

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Laura host a dinner party for Henry Bermont and his wife. But when Rob's old Army buddy shows up, Rob has a hard time asking him to leave.
episodes.title: Sol and the Sponsor

episodes.synopsis: Annoyed that Laura's been reading his mail, Rob writes a skit based on her snooping. Laura is miffed that she's been portrayed as a nosy wife.
episodes.title: The Curious Thing About Women

episodes.synopsis: An old friendship is strained when Rob's dentist pal, Jerry Helper, starts bad-mouthing "The Alan Brady Show," and Rob becomes fighting mad.
episodes.title: Punch Thy Neighbor

episodes.synopsis: After Ritchie asks his parents, "Where did I come from?" Rob and Laura reminisce about the days leading up to his birth in this flashback episode.
episodes.title: Where Did I Come From?

episodes.synopsis: After Rob finds Buddy sleeping at the office while his wife is away, he invites Buddy to stay with him, but his guest quickly wears out his welcome.
episodes.title: The Boarder Incident

episodes.synopsis: The Petries are thrilled at Ritchie's expanding vocabulary -- until Laura overhears him uttering a four-letter word.
episodes.title: A Word a Day

episodes.synopsis: When "The Alan Brady Show" announces a child talent contest, Rob, Sally and Buddy are overwhelmed with parents who think their kids are prodigies.
episodes.title: The Talented Neighborhood

episodes.synopsis: Ritchie doesn't want Rob to speak to his class because he's embarrassed about his dad's job. Rob tries to figure out how to explain comedy to kids.
episodes.title: Father of the Week

episodes.synopsis: Sally discovers a singer who's invented a new dance. But the musician, Randy "Twizzle" Eisenbauer, isn't sure he wants to be known for the Twizzle.
episodes.title: The Twizzle

episodes.synopsis: Rob serves on a jury for the trial of Marla Hendrix, a gorgeous blonde who's accused of larceny.
episodes.title: One Angry Man

episodes.synopsis: Sally feels lonely as her birthday approaches. But when an old acquaintance drops by the office, she hopes he'll bring some romance into her life.
episodes.title: Where You Been, Fassbinder?

episodes.synopsis: Buddy convinces Rob that their wives are dominating them. As if to prove his point, Laura tells Rob to bring in the laundry and check on Ritchie.
episodes.title: The Bad Old Days

episodes.synopsis: When Rob's shy brother, Stacey, arrives in town acting confident and outgoing, it can mean only one thing: He's sleepwalking.
episodes.title: I Am My Brother's Keeper

episodes.synopsis: Rob worries that his brother Stacey will blow an audition because he's bashful. Stacey manages to get the job -- but how will he get through the show?
episodes.title: The Sleeping Brother

episodes.synopsis: After Laura runs into Rob's old mentor, Rob wants to help him make a comeback and hires him, but Buddy and Sally soon tire of his humorless jokes.
episodes.title: The Return of Happy Spangler

episodes.synopsis: When Rob brings a pair of baby ducks home from work, he tries to keep them under wraps so Ritchie doesn't get too attached to them.
episodes.title: Never Name a Duck

episodes.synopsis: Rob calls Laura on the phone and pretends to be another man, all to test a theory that a wife can't always recognize her husband's voice.
episodes.title: The Two Faces of Rob

episodes.synopsis: When Rob finds out that Laura has a secret stash of cash, his first thought is that she's saving up to buy him a movie projector.
episodes.title: Bank Book 6565696

episodes.synopsis: After Ritchie finds one of his parents' forgotten wedding gifts, Rob tells him the story about his proposal to Laura and his wedding misadventures.
episodes.title: The Attempted Marriage

episodes.synopsis: When Buddy's brother challenges Rob to a $300 game of pool, Rob agrees -- only to find out that he's playing a real shark. Can Laura help him out?
episodes.title: Hustling the Hustler

episodes.synopsis: When Ritchie asks what his middle initial stands for, Rob and Laura try explaining it, but the answer is more complicated than Ritchie expected.
episodes.title: What's in a Middle Name?

episodes.synopsis: Hoping to prove Buddy that he's wrong about the powers of hypnotherapy, Rob invites him over for an evening with hypnotist Glen Jameson.
episodes.title: My Husband Is Not a Drunk

episodes.synopsis: In a bid to convince Sally that her handsome new boyfriend, Ric Vallone, isn't Mr. Right, an overprotective Rob tries desperately to get him drunk.
episodes.title: Like a Sister

episodes.synopsis: In the wake of a fight that has Rob and Laura steaming, they vent about it to sympathetic friends, who hear two different versions of what happened.
episodes.title: The Night the Roof Fell In

episodes.synopsis: When Buddy and Sally start acting suspiciously, Rob thinks they're having an affair, which wouldn't be bad except that Buddy is married to Pickles.
episodes.title: The Secret Life of Buddy and Sally

episodes.synopsis: When Ritchie declares that he's been attacked by a woodpecker that thinks his head is a nest, Rob calls in the game warden so it doesn't happen again.
episodes.title: A Bird in the Head Hurts

episodes.synopsis: When Rob starts sneezing during an evening of cards with Laura and their neighbors Jerry and Millie, he wonders whether he's allergic to his wife.
episodes.title: Gesundheit, Darling

episodes.synopsis: With his friend, neighbor and dentist Jerry Helper out of town, Rob is forced to visit another dentist when he accidentally breaks his tooth.
episodes.title: A Man's Teeth Are Not His Own

episodes.synopsis: As director of an amateur theater production about the famed Egyptian beauty Cleopatra, Rob has trouble finding a leading lady.
episodes.title: Somebody Has to Play Cleopatra

episodes.synopsis: After reading about a notorious cat burglar in the newspaper, Laura and Rob awaken to find that the thief is breaking into their home.
episodes.title: The Cat Burglar

episodes.synopsis: When an old high school friend of Rob's, an aspiring actress, comes for a surprise visit, the Petries are delighted -- at first.
episodes.title: The Foul Weather Girl

episodes.synopsis: Rob recalls the time that he got a pass from the Army and wondered whether he should marry Laura or break the heart of a former sexy sweetheart.
episodes.title: Will You Two Be My Wife?

episodes.synopsis: When Rob agrees to be interviewed on a "60 Minutes"-style program, he ends up saying that he gets most of his ideas by observing his wacky wife.
episodes.title: Ray Murdock's X-Ray

episodes.synopsis: A blowup at work prompts Rob to reminisce about his early days as a comedy writer, and he realizes that he's come a long way since then.
episodes.title: I Was a Teenage Head Writer

episodes.synopsis: When Rob and Laura run into friends at a restaurant, Rob insists on paying their checks. Laura has a theory that he tries to buy his friends.
episodes.title: My Husband Is a Check-Grabber

episodes.synopsis: After staying up late to watch a science fiction movie, Rob has a dream involving a walnut that wants to steal his imagination -- and his thumbs.
episodes.title: It May Look Like a Walnut

episodes.synopsis: Citing a recent dream she had in which Rob was injured, Laura tries to talk him out of going on a skiing trip. But Rob goes anyway and gets hurt.
episodes.title: Don't Trip Over That Mountain

episodes.synopsis: After accidentally drawing on the wall, Rob must hire a painter to fix it; Laura suggests Vito Giotto, a man who once stopped by looking for work.
episodes.title: Give Me Your Walls!

episodes.synopsis: When Rob's old Army buddy invites everyone to spend a weekend at his lodge, Rob inadvertently injures the comedian who's slated to perform.
episodes.title: The Sam Pomerantz Scandals

episodes.synopsis: Rob is flattered to be invited to a fancy dinner party for big names in the literary world -- until he finds out he's the only comedy writer there.
episodes.title: I'm No Henry Walden

episodes.synopsis: French singer Jacques Savon is set to appear on "The Alan Brady Show," but Buddy and Sally can't figure out why Rob seems to be dreading it.
episodes.title: The Square Triangle

episodes.synopsis: When Alan goes out of town on vacation, smooth-talking British film star Tracy Rattigan steps in to fill his shoes as host of "The Alan Brady Show.
episodes.title: Racy Tracy Rattigan

episodes.synopsis: When Buddy finds checks that suggest Pickles was married before, he announces he's getting a divorce and puts Rob in the center of the proceedings.
episodes.title: Divorce

episodes.synopsis: When Jim Darling, Laura's old flame, shows up on the set of "The Alan Brady Show," Rob's insecurities fuel his fear that he could lose his wife.
episodes.title: It's a Shame She Married Me

episodes.synopsis: When Rob finds out about the surprise birthday party Laura's been planning for him, what's she supposed to do with all the guests hiding in the house?
episodes.title: A Surprise Surprise Is a Surprise

episodes.synopsis: A charismatic comedian wants to marry Sally and take her away so she can write for him. But are his intentions really romantic or purely business?
episodes.title: Jilting the Jilter

episodes.synopsis: Fresh out of jokes for "The Alan Brady Show," Rob asks Ritchie for advice and gets an interesting idea for a gag -- a talking bowling pin.
episodes.title: When a Bowling Pin Talks, Listen

episodes.synopsis: Ritchie's toy intercom ignites an adult-sized drama when Laura and Rob accidentally tune in to a private conversation between their neighbors.
episodes.title: All About Eavesdropping

episodes.synopsis: Rob reminisces about the day they came home with their new baby. After seeing Ritchie, Rob is convinced the hospital gave them someone else's child.
episodes.title: That's My Boy???

episodes.synopsis: Rob accidentally makes the winning bid on a painting and begins to deface it, believing that there may be a more valuable painting hidden underneath.
episodes.title: The Masterpiece

episodes.synopsis: When Rob asks her to sign some insurance forms, Laura tries to avoid the situation. Laura confesses that she's been hiding a secret for many years.
episodes.title: Laura's Little Lie

episodes.synopsis: After finding out that they're not legally married, Rob and Laura attempt to elope in secret. But keeping their news private will not be easy.
episodes.title: Very Old Shoes, Very Old Rice

episodes.synopsis: Rob agrees to direct the school's annual play, bringing in Sally and Buddy to help, but must choose between his wife and a more talented dancer.
episodes.title: Too Many Stars

episodes.synopsis: Having suffered a severe blow to the head, a confused Rob somehow wanders into a crazy party, all the while believing he's someone else.
episodes.title: Who and Where Was Antonio Stradivarius?

episodes.synopsis: Rob tries to set up his Uncle George with Herman's widowed mother, but the plan backfires when George falls for Herman's girlfriend, Sally, instead.
episodes.title: Uncle George

episodes.synopsis: Mob boss Max asks Rob's work to write a comedy routine for his nephew Kenny, who has no comedic talent. Rob fears what Max might do to him.
episodes.title: Big Max Calvada

episodes.synopsis: Rob purchases a sailboat with Jerry. The two friends argue and disagree over who should be in charge of the boat, which ultimately leads to disaster.
episodes.title: The Ballad of the Betty Lou

episodes.synopsis: Rob decides to hire a maid. But when Spanish maid Maria arrives with a broken arm and no English skills, Rob realizes he may have made a mistake.
episodes.title: Turtles, Ties, and Toreadors

episodes.synopsis: Rob gives the police information on a crime he witnessed, but leave out details and wonders whether informing the police may put him in danger.
episodes.title: The Sound of Trumpets of Conscience Falls Deafly on a Brain That Holds Its Ears

episodes.synopsis: Rob's family takes part in a special holiday episode. While Rob and Laura sing "I Have Everything But You," Sally and Buddy each perform solos.
episodes.title: The Alan Brady Show Presents

episodes.synopsis: When a female dancer develops a crush on Rob, he loses focus at work. Laura thinks it's cute but Rob decides to give the girl the scare of her life.
episodes.title: The Third One from the Left

episodes.synopsis: When he's interviewed for a magazine article on Alan, Rob gives credit to Alan. But the article ends up praising Rob as the show's creative genius.
episodes.title: My Husband is the Best One

episodes.synopsis: Laura accidentally invites both Sally and Donna over to meet her new bachelor neighbor. In order to help Sally, Rob tries to keep Donna away from him.
episodes.title: The Lady and the Tiger and the Lawyer

episodes.synopsis: Rob tells Laura about Joe Coogan, a man he met at the country club. Laura reacts nervously, not wanting to tell Rob that Joe used to be her boyfriend.
episodes.title: The Life and Love of Joe Coogan

episodes.synopsis: After teaching Ritchie tricks with a marked deck, Rob and his friends play cards. Before realizing they're using the marked deck, Rob wins every game.
episodes.title: A Nice, Friendly Game of Cards

episodes.synopsis: Instead of a trip to an amusement park for Ritchie's birthday, Rob wants a backyard party. But when the guests show up, the lawn smells of fertilizer.
episodes.title: Happy Birthday and Too Many More

episodes.synopsis: After Rob comes down with a backache, Laura must cancel their vacation plans. With Laura upset, Rob is unsure whether his pain is real or imagined.
episodes.title: The Brave and the Backache

episodes.synopsis: Sally becomes an overnight sensation and no longer has time to work on writing, leaving Rob and Buddy to figure out how to pick up the slack.
episodes.title: The Pen is Mightier Than the Mouth

episodes.synopsis: With Sally out of the office, Rob hires two temps who turn out to be useless. When Laura agrees to help, Rob discovers that she's better than he is.
episodes.title: My Part-Time Wife

episodes.synopsis: Preparing to go on their honeymoon, Rob and Laura had to change their plans when the commanding officer prevented anyone from leaving the base.
episodes.title: Honeymoons Are for the Lucky

episodes.synopsis: When sexy celebrity Paula Marshall decides to work with Rob, Laura grows worried. Rob learns that behind Paula's beauty lies an egotistical diva.
episodes.title: How to Spank a Star

episodes.synopsis: When Rob's and Laura's parents buy cemetery plots, both sets of parents want Rob and Laura to be buried with them. It's up to Rob to find a solution.
episodes.title: The Plots Thicken

episodes.synopsis: Rob forbids Laura from driving his new car but she uses it to take Ritchie to school. After discovering a scratch, she doesn't know what to tell Rob.
episodes.title: Scratch My Car and Die

episodes.synopsis: Rob puts together an episode that will pay tribute to classic radio comedians. Rob lures Bert Gordon and Arlene Harris, but can't convince Edwin Carp.
episodes.title: The Return of Edwin Carp

episodes.synopsis: When she stumbles across a nude portrait of herself, Laura recalls the painting, which she had originally commissioned as a present for Rob.
episodes.title: October Eve

episodes.synopsis: Laura finds her husband in jail and wants to know what happened. Rob explains how he looked up an old Army buddy who has a knack for trouble.
episodes.title: Dear Mrs. Petrie, Your Husband is in Jail

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Laura see Jerry having dinner with a beautiful blonde. With Jerry's wife nowhere in sight, they suspect that he may be having an affair.
episodes.title: My Neighbor's Husband's Other Life

episodes.synopsis: Anxious that he may be going bald, Rob has a horrible nightmare in which he's completely bald and his family and friends are taunting him.
episodes.title: I'd Rather Be Bald Than Have No Head at All

episodes.synopsis: Rob suspects Laura's creative writing teacher of having ulterior motives, and doesn't believe Laura is as talented as Mr. Caldwell says she is.
episodes.title: Teacher's Petrie

episodes.synopsis: When a magazine reporter requests to observe the writers, Rob is hesitant when the writers let their egos loose in order to impress the reporter.
episodes.title: My Two Show-Off's and Me

episodes.synopsis: Rob winds up in an altercation at a local bar. When Laura steps in to defend her husband with her judo skills, Rob's ego takes the biggest hit.
episodes.title: My Mother Can Beat Up My Father

episodes.synopsis: Rob, Laura, Buddy and Sally leap at Mel's invite for a getaway at a fishing lodge. But strange happenings suggest that the lodge is haunted.
episodes.title: The Ghost of A. Chantz

episodes.synopsis: When Ritchie's new baby sitter, Roger, reveals that he has romantic feelings for Laura, the Petries are at a loss for how to handle the situation.
episodes.title: The Lady and the Babysitter

episodes.synopsis: A neighbor's crabgrass becomes the unlikely catalyst for a bitter political disagreement between Rob and Jerry that threatens to end their friendship.
episodes.title: A Vigilante Ripped My Sports Coat

episodes.synopsis: Rob is offered to become the humor consultant for a new magazine. When Laura expresses her apprehension about the job, Rob reexamines the opportunity.
episodes.title: The Man from 'Emperor'

episodes.synopsis: Sally's long search for a husband may be over when she learns that she's caught the eye of Bert Monker, who's taken to sending gifts to her office.
episodes.title: Romances, Roses, and Rye Bread

episodes.synopsis: On their way to an appointment with Laura's obstetrician, Rob and his wife wind up trapped in an elevator with a bumbling armed robber.
Rob and the gang go to perform at a prison. When Rob is mistaken for an inmate, he ends up sharing a cell with the convicts he was sent to entertain.
episodes.title: The Alan Brady Show Goes to Jail

episodes.synopsis: Rob's job is in jeopardy when a suggestion backfires. To save his job, Millie launches a letter-writing campaign that produces some hilarious results.
episodes.title: Three Letters from One Wife

episodes.synopsis: Rob's old friend Neil hopes that Rob can get him a job on the show. When Rob learns that Neil's cooking up a scheme, he tries to thwart his plan.
episodes.title: Stretch Petrie vs. Kid Schenk

episodes.synopsis: Rob, Sally and Buddy consider striking to get a raise. When Rob visits the show's accountant, he finds himself consumed by finance mumbo jumbo.
episodes.title: It Wouldn't Hurt Them to Give Us a Raise

episodes.synopsis: Laura takes some of Millie's pills to help her feel better. When the pills have intoxicating effects on Laura, Rob realizes he's in for a long night.
episodes.title: Pink Pills and Purple Parents

episodes.synopsis: On the eve of a party, Rob comes down with the flu. Rather than admit how sick he is, Rob tries to conceal his illness and continue to entertain.
episodes.title: The Death of the Party

episodes.synopsis: Rob promises to get revenge for Buddy's pranks and practical jokes. When an IRS agent pays a visit to Buddy, he assumes it's Rob's attempt at payback.
episodes.title: The Impractical Joke

episodes.synopsis: Rob leaves a script at Grand Central Station by mistake. When he receives a ransom note for the script, he doesn't know what to make of the situation.
episodes.title: Brother, Can You Spare $2500?

episodes.synopsis: When Rob's brother Stacey asks Sally to help him develop some dating skills, the two find themselves falling for each other.
episodes.title: Stacey Petrie (Part 1)

episodes.synopsis: With his coffee shop on the verge of closing and his relationship in jeopardy, Rob's brother Stacey turns to Laura and Rob for guidance and support.
episodes.title: Stacey Petrie (Part 2)

episodes.synopsis: When Rob offers his apartment as refuge for rock 'n' roll idols the Redcoats, the Petrie home gets inundated with a horde of hysterical teenagers.
episodes.title: The Redcoats Are Coming

episodes.synopsis: Rob regrets casting Ritchie and Freddie in a commercial for "The Alan Brady Show" when Laura and Millie transform into insufferable stage mothers.
episodes.title: Boy #1, Boy #2

episodes.synopsis: When Rob's attempt to get a refund for some ill-smelling pillows is declined, he takes it upon himself to fight the salesman in small-claims court.
episodes.title: The Case of the Pillow

episodes.synopsis: Buddy convinces Rob to join him in investing in his Uncle Lou's shoe store. But Rob learns that the shoe business isn't all it's cracked up to be.
episodes.title: Young Man With a Shoehorn

episodes.synopsis: Pretty Pricilla Darwell has a crush on Ritchie, but that's not what's unnerving Rob and Laura. It's the way Pricilla chooses to show her affection.
episodes.title: Girls Will Be Boys

episodes.synopsis: When Rob learns that he's not listed as one of the songwriters on a soon-to-be hit he helped write, he fights to get his share of the royalties.
episodes.title: Bupkis

episodes.synopsis: When the Petries finally find their dream home, their spirits are quashed when they learn that Rob's friend is bidding on the same house.
episodes.title: Your Home Sweet Home is My Home Sweet Home

episodes.synopsis: Sally's excited about her new beau, Anthony. When Buddy and Rob discover the reason Anthony's so secretive, they must break the bad news to Sally.
episodes.title: Anthony Stone

episodes.synopsis: The Petries take a much-needed getaway. But their plans for a romantic escape go right down the drain when Laura's toe gets stuck in a bathtub spout.
episodes.title: Never Bathe on Saturday

episodes.synopsis: Rob remembers his interview for "The Alan Brady Show," which was scheduled after a radio broadcast that kept Rob on the air for 100 straight hours.
episodes.title: 100 Terrible Hours

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Laura agree to accept an award on Alan Brady's behalf. But when they accidentally dye their hands black, they find themselves in a pickle.
episodes.title: Show of Hands

episodes.synopsis: Rob agrees to do some rewrites on the play in which Alan Brady is starring. But when it's more than just rewrites, Rob wishes he hadn't taken the job.
episodes.title: Baby Fat

episodes.synopsis: Rob trades the family car for a motorcycle. But when he gets mistaken for a delinquent and arrested, he quickly regrets his impulsive purchase.
episodes.title: Br-rooom, Br-rooom

episodes.synopsis: Buddy offers Rob and Laura the chance to buy a fur coat at a wholesale price. But the Petries realize that deals like this are too good to be true.
episodes.title: There's No Sale Like Wholesale

episodes.synopsis: Rob takes time off to write a novel. But after distractions and bouts of writer's block, he questions whether he's really cut out to be a novelist.
episodes.title: A Farewell to Writing

episodes.synopsis: During the broadcast of a nationally televised quiz show, Laura reveals that Alan Brady wears a toupee. Now, Rob must put Alan and his ego at ease.
episodes.title: Coast-to-Coast Big Mouth

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Buddy are perplexed by a tiny flying saucer darting through the office halls, and discover a mad scientist working in the office upstairs.
episodes.title: Uhny Uftz

episodes.synopsis: The producers use a dog from a pound in a comedy sketch. But once the dog's work is done, Rob tries to find a home for the unsightly canine.
episodes.title: The Ugliest Dog in the World

episodes.synopsis: Rob recollects an Army raffle when Laura was the prize of the event. To win her hand, Rob had to keep Laura from falling for his rival, Clark Rice.
episodes.title: No Rice at My Wedding

episodes.synopsis: Laura convinces Rob to enroll in a new art class. When Rob captures the eye of the beautiful instructor, Laura regrets ever bringing him along.
episodes.title: Draw Me a Pear

episodes.synopsis: Rob may be the recipient of a family inheritance. After a fruitless search for the mysterious treasure, Rob ponders the value of a vintage photograph.
episodes.title: The Great Petrie Fortune

episodes.synopsis: Ritchie fools Rob into thinking his back freckles form the shape of the Liberty Bell. When Rob thinks it'll bring in a fortune, Ritchie comes clean.
episodes.title: Odd But True

episodes.synopsis: Maria asks Rob to find a job for her boyfriend. When Rob fails to find something Manuel's qualified to do, the Petries wind up with a new handyman.
episodes.title: Viva Petrie

episodes.synopsis: When school officials catch wind of Ritchie's version of "the birds and the bees," Rob and Laura are forced to meet with the school psychologist.
episodes.title: Go Tell the Birds and the Bees

episodes.synopsis: Rob shares his memories of being an Army camp boxer. Rob recollects his title-defending bout against formidable challenger Boom-Boom Bailey.
episodes.title: Body and Sol

episodes.synopsis: A local artist wants to find a writer who can create children's stories to accompany his illustrations, and Laura finds herself competing with Rob.
episodes.title: See Rob Write, Write Rob, Write

episodes.synopsis: After a fight with Laura, Rob heads to the drive-in. After sleeping through the movie, he awakens to discover he's accused of assaulting an old woman.
episodes.title: You're Under Arrest

episodes.synopsis: Rob looks back on leaner times. With an expectant wife, a new home in need of furnishing and a career, young Rob Petrie worried about the future.
episodes.title: Fifty-Two, Forty-Five or Work

episodes.synopsis: When the expensive watch that Laura bought Rob for Christmas goes missing, Rob accuses everyone around him, alienating his friends and co-workers.
episodes.title: Who Stole My Watch?

episodes.synopsis: Following a speech he gave at a city council meeting, Rob is asked to seriously consider running for councilman of New Rochelle.
episodes.title: I Do Not Choose to Run

episodes.synopsis: Rob knows he's out of his league in the run for city council when he comes face-to-face with his opponent: the ultra-intelligent Lincoln Goodheart.
episodes.title: The Making of a Councilman

episodes.synopsis: Laura accidentally destroys an heirloom that Rob's parents gave her. With her mother-in-law's impending visit, she races to piece it back together.
episodes.title: The Curse of the Petrie People

episodes.synopsis: When Mel is reprimanded regarding a script change, Rob convinces him to stand up for himself. But the advice backfires and Alan fires Mel.
episodes.title: The Bottom of Mel Cooley's Heart

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Laura recall a time when a trip to Mexico -- by way of Texas -- and a $10 divorce fee nearly brought their marriage to an end.
episodes.title: Remember the Alimony

episodes.synopsis: Sally takes her hunt for a husband to television. When the identity of one of her suitors is revealed, Sally will be in for the shock of her life.
episodes.title: Dear Sally Rogers

episodes.synopsis: Thinking Buddy is either seeing a psychiatrist or cheating on his wife, Rob and Laura are dumbfounded when they discover the reasons for his behavior.
episodes.title: Buddy Sorrell, Man and Boy

episodes.synopsis: Rob promises Alan he'll take notes on a fashion show that's scheduled to air at the same time Rob's expected to usher at his cousin's wedding.
episodes.title: Bad Reception in Albany

episodes.synopsis: When Rob learns there may be layoffs, he applies for a job as the assistant to a ventriloquist, whose puppet is an obnoxious and abusive snail.
episodes.title: Talk to the Snail

episodes.synopsis: The party the Petries host for the Helpers is going off without a hitch -- until Alan Brady shows up and films a documentary on a day in his own life.
episodes.title: A Day in the Life of Alan Brady

episodes.synopsis: When a mock script that's peppered with insults about the boss is accidentally delivered to Alan's office, Rob hatches a plan to retrieve it.
episodes.title: Obnoxious, Offensive, Egomaniac, Etc.

episodes.synopsis: When government agents suspect the Petries' next-door neighbor of foul play, they turn Ritchie's bedroom into a surveillance stakeout point.
episodes.title: The Man from My Uncle

episodes.synopsis: When Rob is cast in a low-budget film, Laura learns that he's playing the love interest of a beautiful Italian starlet, and goes through the roof.
episodes.title: You Ought to Be in Pictures

episodes.synopsis: Rob and Laura become friends with their new neighbors. When Millie announces how jealous she is, the Petries find themselves in a sticky position.
episodes.title: Love Thy Other Neighbor

episodes.synopsis: Rob joins Jerry for an overnight fishing trip, leaving Laura to endure a series of strange occurrences and things that go bump in the night.
episodes.title: Long Night's Journey into Day

episodes.synopsis: Rob dreams he's the sheriff of an Old West town, where he's charged with keeping the peace and protecting the town from the dastardly Big Bad Brady.
episodes.title: The Gunslinger

episodes.synopsis: Rob finishes the autobiography he's been writing. Rob reveals that although his publisher hates the book, Alan has bought it for a new TV series.
episodes.title: The Last Chapter
